messages.subject: Re: UNITED NATIONS ASSISTED PROGRAMME
messages.body:
In a message dated 9/10/2010 12:20:50 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, info@unitednation.org writes:


UNITED NATIONS ASSISTED PROGRAMME


Our Ref: WB/NF/UN/XX0296
PHONE: +0044 70557 55261
PAKISTANI FLOOD RELIEF
Dear Sir/Ma,


The united Nations Development Foundation and its partners are working on immediate relief, recovery and reconstruction in Pakistan. Donations will be used for all three, key phases in Pakistan.


UNDF, the natural disaster relief arm of the Organization of United Kingdom, has more than 150 people working Pakistan on economic development, disaster mitigation and protecting human rights. UNDF is a non-profit, 501(c)(3) organization based in London and Pakistan.


The Devastating Flood that shattered Pakistan, the poorest country in the Middle East Hemisphere, has already claimed the lives of tens of thousands, perhaps even hundreds of thousands and have destroyed properties. Approximately 1 million people, about a third of Pakistan population, will be affected directly or indirectly from the Flood and its aftermath. The search for survivors continues unabated, but as time goes by the chances of finding survivors are reduced.


The United Nations Development Foundation is among the countries leading aid efforts in Pakistan. Our workers and doctors have been working tirelessly to rescue and heal thousands of the victim in Pakistan. A day after the Flood, NATAN, a national humanitarian relief operation uniting the efforts of dozens of specialist non-profit organizations specializing in emergency aid, flew to Pakistan to distribute medical care and life saving equipment, and to provide professional aid. This team will soon be joined - with your help - by 20 more aid missions specializing in rehabilitation, care for the homeless, aid for orphans, psycho-social and post-trauma support by mental-health professionals, and basic medical aid. With your support, we can send these specialist teams to Pakistan without delay and fully supplied.


Every team consists of 10 volunteer professional and will stay in Pakistan for 24 days. Expenses are estimated at $2,000 per day - every dollar of support will allow us to bring the best specialist aid to Pakistan and keep our teams there as long as possible.


Every donation will help. All donations are fully tax-deductible NO amount is too small save a soul and life .


To donate by Western Union Transfer: Send to.


Name: Abdul-latif Montharf
Address:123 Saint Lucas road,London 
City:London
Country:United Kingdom
Indicate your full name the amount and send the MTCN number Back to us


Thank you for your Donation as GOD bless you too.
Regards
AHMED KHAN,


for Pakistani flood relief
messages.raw:
AHMED KHAN

The Earl of Court
I beg your pardon?

messages.body:
9/10/2010


every donations will be use for education and building of new schools and others because The floods and flash rains in the country have not only damaged agricultural crops, livestock, fisheries and forestry, but have destroyed primary infrastructure such as tube wells, water channels, household storages, houses, animal sheds, personal seed stocks and fertilizers; as well as other agriculture, machinery and equipment,


Please help children and families devastated by floods by making a contribution to our Pakistan relief fund


Every donation will help. All donations are fully tax-deductible NO amount is too small save a soul and life .


To donate by Western Union Transfer: Send to.


Name: Abdul-latif Montharf
Address:123 Saint Lucas road,London 
City:London
Country:United Kingdom
Indicate your full name the amount and send the MTCN number Back to us


Thank you for your Donation as GOD bless you too.
Regards
AHMED KHAN,


for Pakistani flood relief

messages.body: Since I anticipate making a generous donation, I would prefer that someone come to my office and pick up a cheque. We are conveniently located in Kensington at 72, Earls Court Road, and someone will be there to receive your messenger at any time.
messages.raw:
The Earl of Court

Since I anticipate making a generous donation, I would prefer that someone come to my office and pick up a cheque. We are conveniently located in Kensington at 72, Earls Court Road, and someone will be there to receive your messenger at any time.

It is the Kensington Police Station. He he he.

messages.body:
I have authorised my office to prepare a bearer bond in the amount of 35,000 pounds. If you want it, you must come and get it. 

The address, in case you've forgotten, is 72, Earls Court Road, Kensington, W8 London. I will instruct my secretary to expect you between 9:00 and 17:00 GMT.

messages.body: I do very much want to help, but I have had unpleasant experiences with Western Union in the past, and prefer to deal with people on a face-to-face basis, especially when such large sums are involved. I'm certain I can find other avenues by which I can make a donation, if you are unwilling to come to Kensington.
messages.raw:
The Earl of Court

To: ahmedkhan506@gmail.com
Sent: 9/11/2010 12:02:05 A.M.

I'm certain I can find other avenues by which I can make a donation, if you are unwilling to come to Kensington.
